name: Esther's Kitchen
oneLiner: Handmade pasta and wine when you want cozy but serious food.
story: This is my go-to for a real dinner without Strip chaos. The room feels warm and local, and the pasta never misses. Sit at the bar if you want to chat with the staff and feel like a regular.
signatureMove: Order the seasonal pasta and split a bottle.

name: The Golden Tiki
oneLiner: Wild tiki bar with strong drinks and louder decor.
story: If you want a night that feels like a movie set, this is it. The drinks are generous, the soundtrack is loud, and the room is full of little surprises. Bring friends who will commit to the theme.
signatureMove: Grab the Mai Tai and claim a booth.
bestTime: After 10pm when the neon wakes up.

name: Skyfall Lounge
oneLiner: High floor view with velvet booths and a night breeze.
story: This is where I take people who want a skyline moment without a club ticket. The elevator ride alone feels cinematic. Show up at sunset and the whole city flips on around you.
signatureMove: Arrive at sunset and order the mezcal cocktail.

name: Tacos El Gordo
oneLiner: Fast line, perfect al pastor, zero drama.
story: This is the move when everyone is hungry and you need one answer. Order at the al pastor window, grab salsas, and keep it moving. It is cheap, fast, and always hits.
signatureMove: Order al pastor tacos and a vampiro.
bestTime: After midnight or before the clubs.

name: The Neon Museum
oneLiner: Vintage neon boneyard with real Vegas history.
story: If you want proof that old Vegas still glows, start here. The outdoor yard is full of rescued signs and quiet stories. Go at night for the full effect and bring a jacket.
signatureMove: Book the night tour and bring a hoodie.

name: Peppermill Restaurant & Fireside Lounge
oneLiner: Old-school Vegas lounge with neon fire pits and late-night plates.
story: If you want a classic Vegas reset without the club scene, this is the move. The lounge is dark, warm, and full of neon glow.
signatureMove: Grab a fire-side booth and split the nachos.
bestTime: Late night or after a show.
warnings: The lounge gets busy after midnight.

name: The Griffin
oneLiner: Candlelit lounge downtown when you want a low-key drink.
story: Dim lights, brick walls, and a calm soundtrack. It is the kind of spot that slows the night down in the best way.
signatureMove: Order an old fashioned and grab a corner booth.
warnings: Seating is limited on busy weekends.

name: Legacy Club
oneLiner: Rooftop lounge with skyline views and clean pours.
story: Come for the view, stay for the atmosphere. It is high up, a little dressy, and perfect for skyline photos.
signatureMove: Order a martini and step out to the terrace.

name: Suzuya Patisserie
oneLiner: Japanese pastries and light desserts when you want something clean.
story: A calm counter with precise cakes and soft lighting. Perfect for a sweet stop after dinner.
warnings: Arrive early for the best selection.

name: Eggslut
oneLiner: Fast breakfast sandwiches with soft eggs and crisp potatoes.
story: Quick line, big payoff. This is the breakfast stop when you need something hot and simple before the day starts.
signatureMove: Get the Fairfax and a side of potatoes.
bestTime: Mornings before the crowds or late brunch.

name: The Sand Dollar Lounge
oneLiner: Live blues and rock with a real local bar feel.
story: Small stage, strong band nights, and a crowd that cares about the music. A solid pick when you want live sound without the mega venue.
signatureMove: Catch the house band and order a whiskey.
warnings: Cover charges can vary by night.
